attributes.action: Two weeks of paid leave for mothers and partners who experience pregnancy loss
attributes.additional_details: Providing bereavement leave recognises the significant impact of pregnancy loss and promotes better mental health and well-being for those affected. It also sends a compassionate message that the UK government understands the importance of allowing parents time to grieve and recover after such a heartbreaking experience. A loss before 24 weeks is no less painful than a later loss and the emotional, physical and mental toll it takes on parents must be acknowledged.
attributes.background: We call on the UK Government to introduce two weeks of paid bereavement leave for mothers and partners who experience pregnancy loss before 24 weeks.

rejection.details:
The following petition calls for the same action: 

Entitlement to bereavement leave after baby loss in first 24 weeks of pregnancy

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/700852
